Package model.portfolio

Interface Portfolio

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BetterPortfolio
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BetterPortfolioImpl, SimplePortfolio
    public interface Portfolio
    Represents a portfolio of stocks. A portfolio is a collection of stocks and the quantity of each stock. The portfolio can be used to buy and sell stocks. To get the total value of the portfolio on a given date. The portfolio can also be used to get the value of a specific stock. This includes across different dates in this portfolio on a given date.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double buy​(java.lang.String stockName, double amount)
      Buys the given amount of the given stock.
      Portfolio clone()
      Returns a clone of the given portfolio.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> getAmount​(java.time.LocalDate time)
      returns the amounts of each Stock, in the form of a ticker mapped to an amount of shares.
      double getValue​(java.lang.String stockName, java.time.LocalDate date)
      Gets the value of the given stock in the portfolio, on the given date.
      double sell​(java.lang.String stockName, double amount)
      Sells the given amount of the given stock.
      java.lang.String toString()  
      double totalValue​(java.time.LocalDate date)
      Returns the totalValue of this portfolio on the given date.

    • Method Detail

      • totalValue

        double totalValue​(java.time.LocalDate date)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the totalValue of this portfolio on the given date. Assumes that all stocks and quantities exist on the given date.
        Parameters:
        date - the date to find the value of all the stocks
        Returns:
        the value of all the stocks in this portfolio on the given date.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given date does not exist for any of the stocks.

      • getValue

        double getValue​(java.lang.String stockName,
                java.time.LocalDate date)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the value of the given stock in the portfolio, on the given date. The value is based on the closing price of the given stock.
        Parameters:
        stockName - the name of the stock.
        date - the date that you want the value of
        Returns:
        the value of the given stock on the given date.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given stock does not exist in this portfolio or if the given date does not exist for the given stock.

      • buy

        double buy​(java.lang.String stockName,
           double amount)
    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Buys the given amount of the given stock.
        Parameters:
        stockName - the name of the stock to buy.
        amount - the amount of the stock to buy.
        Returns:
        the total value of the stock bought, for the last available price of the stock.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given stock does not exist.

      • sell

        double sell​(java.lang.String stockName,
            double amount)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sells the given amount of the given stock.
        Parameters:
        stockName - the name of the stock to sell.
        amount - the amount of the stock to sell.
        Returns:
        the total value of the stock sold.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given stock does not exist, or if the given amount is greater than the quantity of the stock in this portfolio.

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • clone

        Portfolio clone()
        Returns a clone of the given portfolio.
        Returns:
        the clone of the given portfolio.

      • getAmount

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> getAmount​(java.time.LocalDate time)
        returns the amounts of each Stock, in the form of a ticker mapped to an amount of shares.
        Parameters:
        time - the time period you want the amount at.
        Returns:
        the mapped tickers to amounts of stock at any given point in time.
